alert.note: Alert for South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 22 at 11:33AM EST until December 24 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...South Walton County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 1 PM EST this afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Water levels will rise to between 1.5 ft and 2.5 ft mean higher high water, which will result in minor inundation of areas along the beachfront. In addition to the coastal flood risk, there is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will be highest around the time of high tide, which is this evening around 7 pm CT at Panama City Beach. The threat for coastal flooding will end when winds shift offshore by daybreak Friday.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
